Section.Label: Chapter_Polytope_Constructions_and_Operations_Section_Extensions_amalgamations_and_quotients
Section.Heading: Extensions, amalgamations, and quotients

ManSection.Description: Constructs the universal polytope of rank n.
Constructs the universal extension of M, i.e. the maniplex with facets isomorphic to M that covers all other maniplexes with facets isomorphic to M. Currently only defined for reflexible maniplexes.

Section.Example: gap> UniversalExtension(Cube(3)); regular 4-polytope of type [ 4, 3, infinity ] with infinity flags

ManSection.Description: Constructs the universal extension of M with last entry of Schlafli symbol k. Currently only defined for reflexible maniplexes.

Section.Example: gap> UniversalExtension(Cube(3),2); regular 4-polytope of type [ 4, 3, 2 ] with 96 flags

ManSection.Description: Constructs the trivial extension of M, also known as {M, 2}.

Section.Example: gap> TrivialExtension(Dodecahedron()); regular 4-polytope of type [ 5, 3, 2 ] with 240 flags

ManSection.Returns: IsManiplex#! @Description Constructs the flat extension of M with last entry of Schlafli symbol k. (As defined in Flat Extensions of Abstract Polytopes .)
ManSection.Description: Currently only defined for reflexible maniplexes.

Section.Example: gap> FlatExtension(Simplex(3),4); reflexible 4-maniplex of type [ 3, 3, 4 ] with 48 flags

ManSection.Description: Constructs the amalgamation of M1 and M2. Implicitly assumes that M1 and M2 are compatible. Currently only defined for reflexible maniplexes.
Given a 3-maniplex M, returns its medial.

ManSection.Returns: The maniplex that is dual to M.
Whether this maniplex is isomorphic to its dual.
ManSection.Description: Also works for IsPoset objects.

ManSection.Returns: The Petrial (Petrie dual) of M. Note that this is not necessarily a polytope, even if M is. When Rank(M) > 3, this is the "generalized Petrial" which essentially replaces r_{n-3} with r_{n-3} r_{n-1} in the set of generators.
Whether this maniplex is isomorphic to its Petrial.

ManSection.Description: Returns a list of the direct derivates of M, which are the images of M under duality and Petriality. A 3-maniplex has up to 6 direct derivates, and an n-maniplex with n \geq 4 has up to 8. If the option 'polytopal' is set, then only returns those direct derivates that are polytopal.
Returns the pyramid over M.
Returns the pyramid over a k-gon.
Returns the prism over M.
Returns the prism over a k-gon.
Returns the antiprism over M.
Returns the antiprism over a k-gon.
Given two maniplexes, this forms the join product. May give weird results if the maniplexes aren't faithfully represented by their posets.
Given two maniplexes, this forms the cartesian product. May give weird results if the maniplexes aren't faithfully represented by their posets.
Given two maniplexes, this forms the direct sum. May give weird results if the maniplexes aren't faithfully represented by their posets.
Given two maniplexes, this forms the direct sum. May give weird results if the maniplexes aren't faithfully represented by their posets.
